1.text: Place the Ticket to Ride board map on a table.

2.text: Pass out a set of 45 Colored Train Cars to each player.

3.text: Put each player’s scoring marker in the lower left corner of the board.

4.text: Shuffle the Train Car cards and deal out 4 to each player.

5.text: Stack the leftover Train Car cards in the center and flip 5 cards face-up.

6.text: Place the Continuous Path bonus card face up next to the board.

7.text: Shuffle and deal 3 Destination Ticket cards to each player.

8.text: Allow each player to choose which Destination Tickets they want to keep.

9.text: Get the most experienced player to go first.

10.text: Perform 1 of 3 possible actions during your turn.

11.text: Draw 2 Train Car cards from the deck or the face up cards.

12.text: Claim a Route by playing a set of cards equal to the spaces in the Route.

13.text: Draw 3 Destination Tickets and keep at least 1 of them.

14.text: Score points by completing the 3 possible objectives.

15.text: Claim a Route between 2 adjacent cities to earn points.

16.text: Move your scoring marker whenever you connect 2 cities.

17.text: Connect 2 cities listed on your Destination Tickets.

18.text: Complete the Longest Continuous Path to earn bonus points.

19.text: Start the final turn when 1 player gets down to 2 or fewer trains.

20.text: Reveal your Destination Tickets and calculate their values.

21.text: Give the player with the Longest Continuous Path the bonus card.

22.text: Add together each player’s points to determine a winner.
